section.name: Current Status
section.p: For all current contributors and anyone wishing to contribute to or use HttpClient, we are now in the Beta 1 development stage.
There is currently a rather complete list of bugs in bugzilla now. To find them, do a query for the *Commons* project, *HttpClient* component, and target milestone *2.0 Beta 1*.

There are some strightforward tasks, some complex tasks, and some long and tedious tasks somthing for everyone. All of the bugs that are marked for milestone Beta 1 will have to be closed before a Beta 1 drop can be released.

If you are interested in working on any task, please reassign the bug to yourself and add the list address to the cc field (commons-httpclient-dev@jakarta-apache.org). When you have a patch, it can be attached directly to the bug. Any discussion can take place on the mailing list.

While the Alpha 2 release was finished only recently, it was 14 months from the previous Alpha 1 release. While there were many reasons for the previous delay, none of those obstacles are in our way for the Beta 1 drop, which we would like to see within the month of February.

section.name: Action Items
section.p: Like to help? There are a number of action items to work on. We make extensive use of Bugzilla where HttpClient can be found as a *component* of the Commons *program*. We also mark //TODO and //FIXME comments in the source files, so they can be easily found by grep or by the Checkstyle report

To volunteer for a task, send an email to
commons-httpclient-dev@jakarta.apache.org.
